course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Personal Genomics and Medicine: Why Should You Care About What's in Your Genes

notes.note: Preference given to freshmen and sophomores.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Orientation Lectures in Molecular Biology and Genetics

notes.note: Intended for freshmen, sophomores, and transfer students. Class will meet on January 26th, February 2nd and February 9th.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Introductory Biology: Cell and Developmental Biology

notes.note: Biological science majors must take this course for a letter grade.
Highly recommended: problem-solving sessions.

Prerequisite or co-requisite: BIOMG 2800; BIOG 1500 strongly recommended as pre-requisite. Not open to freshman, fall semester. Biological sciences majors must take course for a letter grade. Course has an evening prelim.

Prerequisite: one majors-level biology course and one year general chemistry; and CHEM 1570, or 3570-3580, or equivalents; or permission of instructor. CHEM 3580 may be co-registered. May not be taken for credit after BIOMG 3310, 3320, 3330, 3350 or NS 3200. Co-registration in BIOMG 3340 is encouraged. Biological sciences majors must take course for a letter grade. Organizational meeting: Monday, Jan. 21st, 4:30 P.M., BKL 200. Attendance is required.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Principles of Biochemistry: Proteins, Metabolism, and Molecular Biology

notes.note: Prerequisite: one majors-level biology course; and one year general chemistry, and CHEM 1570, or CHEM 3570-3580; or equivalents, or permission of instructor. CHEM 3580 may be co-registration. May not be taken for credit after BIOMG 3300, BIOMG 3310, BIOMG 3320, BIOMG 3330 or NS 3200. Biological sciences majors must take course for a letter grade.

Prerequisite: BIOMG 3300 or BIOMG 3330 or BIOMG 3350 or BIOMG 3310; previous or co-registration in BIOMG 3320, or equivalent. Recommended prerequisite: BIOMG 2800 and 2801. Undergraduate students must enroll in this course for letter grade; graduate students may enroll either for letter grade or S-U option.
Concurrent enrollment in BIOMG 4320 (expected),or previous BIOMG 4320 with B grade or higher, or consent of instructor.
Enrollment is limited to: upper-classman. Prerequisite: BIOMG 3300, or 3330, or 3350 or 3310/3320, or written permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: BIOMG 3300, or 3330, or 3350, or 3310/3320 or permission of instructor.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Laboratory in Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

notes.note: Prerequisites: BIOMG 3300, or BIOMG 3330, or BIOMG 3350, or BIOMG 3310/BIOMG 3320 (at least one of BIOMG 3310/BIOMG 3320 completed but one may be taken concurrently). Priority given to undergraduate biology majors in Biochemistry or Molecular and Cell Biology programs of study and to graduate students with a minor in field of biochemistry. Graduate students must enroll by permission only. Limited enrollment.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Laboratory in Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

notes.note: Prerequisites: BIOMG 3300, or BIOMG 3330, or BIOMG 3350, or BIOMG 3310/BIOMG 3320 (at least one of BIOMG 3310/BIOMG 3320 completed but one may be taken concurrently). Priority given to undergraduate biology majors in Biochemistry or Molecular and Cell Biology programs of study and to graduate students with a minor in field of biochemistry. Graduate students must enroll by permission only. Limited enrollment.

course.subject: BIOMG

notes.note: Prerequisite: BIOMG 4320 or BIOMG 3850 or permission of instructor. S-U grades by permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: BIOEE 1780, BIOMG 2810, BIOMG 3300, or 3330, or 3320, or 3350. Recommended prerequisite: BIOMG 3850.
Prerequisite: BIOMG 2800.

Prerequisite: previous enrollment in course to be taught or equivalent. Note: Arts students may not count this course toward graduation but may, upon petition (one time only) to their class dean, carry fewer than 12 other credits and remain in good standing. This would affect Dean's List eligibility but not eligibility for graduating with distinction. ndependent Study Form (Available online: http://cals.cornell.edu/academics/registrar/policies/#independent-study). course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Current Topics in Genetics and Development

notes.note: Organization meeting will be held on January 23rd, in Biotech Bldg, room 271 from 4-5p.m.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Research Seminar in Genetics and Development

notes.note: Enrollment limited to and required for: second-year and beyond graduate students in genetics and development.
Enrollment limited to: graduate students in Genetics and Development.

Organization meeting March 18th-Savage Hall,room 127, noon-1:30pm. This short course addresses the mechanisms whereby nutrients and metabolic state regulate mammalian chromatic modifications to alter gene expression patterns to maintain homeostasis and survival, and/or influence genome stability. (

Organization meeting TBA. This topic will comprise an introduction to important viruses of biomedical concern, and cover existing and future strategies in drug discovery for these viruses. Viruses will include HIV, herpesviruses, influenza and hepatitis C, among others. The course will link virus replication strategies at both molecular and population levels to the development of effective therapeutics.

Organization Meeting TBA. This minicourse will present fundamental switching mechanisms employed by proteins to alter function in response to a change in environment, such as a phosphorylation event or a change in pH. Examples in which a detailed mechanism is understood at the structural and thermodynamic levels will be highlighted.
Enrollment limited to: graduate students majoring in field of biochemistry, molecular and cell Biology.
Enrollment limited to and required for: first-year graduate students in field of biochemistry, molecular and cell biology.
Enrollment limited to and required for: second-, third-, and fourth-year graduate students majoring in field of biochemistry, molecular and cell biology.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Quantitative Biology for Molecular Biology and Genetics

notes.note: Enrollment limited to: first-year Ph.D. students in the graduate fields of biochemistry, molecular and cell biology, or genetics and development. For all other students, permission of instructor is required.

Enrollment limited to: second-year graduate students majoring in field of biochemistry, molecular and cell biology. All other students, permission of instructor is required. Organizational Meeting: Jan 21; 5 PM; Room 180 Biotech Building.
